column4: Someone mind having a browse at this pastebin and telling me what I'm doing wrong? trying to compile a .tar
what is the output of:  lsb_release -sc
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:vincent-c/conky; sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get install conky     gives you 1.8.1
- was my syntax to compiling a .tar file correct, though? Just unlucky on a dependancy?
the ppa will give the version you want
no idea, but there is a ppa with a binary of what you need, so why bother
no idea, that's why I asked!
if you don't see it, run it in a terminal. You may need to copy a .conkyrc from in the OS (or online) to make it run
seems your compile needs lua5.1 installing
that's just a dependancy based on whatever package I was trying to compile? Nothing wrong with my method of compiling the package at all?
looks spot on, just needed to satisfy deps
I'm just happy I got the syntax correct ;) avoided the immediate problem. Cheers!
np, using PPAs makes life a tonne easier, plus the packages will gel with the existing ones making install / remove as easy as any other package
